leaflet.constituency: Chiswick, Brentford, Isleworth, Osterley and Hounslow

messages.title: Competent Leadership
messages.content: The leaflet compares 'Competent Leadership' with 'Coalition of chaos', associating the former with reducing the deficit, lowering income tax, creating more jobs, and supporting new businesses; while framing the latter with increased spending and debt, higher taxes, and job losses.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The focus is on long-term economic planning, reducing the deficit, growing the economy, and creating jobs.
Engagement with schools about the impact of a third runway at Heathrow and discussing better childcare support and education with families.
Crime is down 18% and following Mary's domestic abuse summit in Chiswick, the Home Secretary has announced a nationwide £10m fund to support victims of domestic abuse.
Local youth unemployment is down by over 47%, over 4,400 apprenticeships have been created and 9,400 new jobs since Mary was elected in 2010.
Mary secured 30 minutes for the local health service every week at one local surgery, as well as an A&E at West Middlesex University Hospital when it is upgraded.
Continues to raise with the Prime Minister the need to make affordable housing should be included in the planning decisions for all new developments.

mentions.candidate: Mary Macleod asserts that she has been a strong voice in government, has a proven track record and that she lives in the local area.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The leaflet suggests opposing parties will raise spending and debt, and increase taxes.

issues.economy: Plans for economic growth are mentioned along with efforts to reduce the deficit and lower taxes.
issues.education: Engaged in discussion about the potential impact of Heathrow expansion on local schools and families.
issues.health: 30-minute weekly health slots secured at a local surgery and improvements planned for a local hospital.

housing.content: Pushing for the need to include affordable housing in all new development plans.

leaflet.personalStatement: Mary Macleod states her background and emphasizes her commitment to the local area and being the local voice in government.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Brentford and Isleworth
politicalExperience.achievements: Proven track record of delivering for the area, securing time for local health services, and being a part of planning discussions for Heathrow and local businesses.

images.caption: Persuading the Chancellor to reduce business rates and give £1m to London Air Ambulance.
At Chatsworth School speaking to pupils about the impact of a third & fourth runway at Heathrow.
Discussing better childcare and support for new businesses with female entrepreneurs.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet stresses the importance of this General Election and the strategic choices facing the electorate, promoting Mary Macleod’s personal involvement and achievements in the constituency.
